Author: lostmybiscuit
Text: I don't have any experience with it. but, just in case you don't get any other answers, I do know that the guided self-help module with that book is basically a modified self-help version of CBT-E.   there's actually pretty decent evidence that GSH as an stop-gap before treatment is specifically significantly more (for an ED treatment anyway) beneficial for reducing binge eating and increasing restraint in comparison to just waiting on a wait list. if you don't mind reading research, this [paper](https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Chris_Williams7/publication/51708795_A_computer_isn%27t_gonna_judge_you_A_qualitative_study_of_users%27_views_of_an_internet-based_cognitive_behavioural_guided_self-care_treatment_package_for_bulimia_nervosa_and_related_disorders/links/55df06cc08ae79830bb64c09/A-computer-isnt-gonna-judge-you-A-qualitative-study-of-users-views-of-an-internet-based-cognitive-behavioural-guided-self-care-treatment-package-for-bulimia-nervosa-and-related-disorders.pdf) (PDF warning) has qualitative analysis of and a lot of quotes by participants describing the pros and cons of internet-based GSH in the UK.   also, hey, best of luck in recovery <3
